name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Valley Forge

reviews.title: Very good hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night and really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is well located near the highway, the King of Prussia Mall, and Valley Forge National Park. The mall does increase traffic during the day though.
The room is very clean, modern, and comfortable. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've stayed in. The bathroom was clean and the shower had pretty good pressure.
reviews.title: Good Conference Hotel

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, free wireless, free parking

reviews.text: I would recommend avoiding the restaurant in the lobby. It is way overpriced, the staff is unfriendly, and the food is not good.
reviews.title: Good location, clean, adequate service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife attended a small regional conference at the hotel and my daughter, her friend and I went along as well.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: My daughter and her friend thoroughly enjoyed themselves at the KOP mall. I walked the whole place and then found some coffee and an outlet for my laptop, The Crowne Plaza is right across the street from the mall and is convenient place to stay.
reviews.title: Room - reasonable; Staff, not so

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during a visit to Philadelphia. The hotel is not far from downtown, however, we faced a lot of traffic everytime we took I-76, in both directions, and that was on a weekend. The hotel is located right next to the King of Prussia Mall, which conveniently provides lots of options for meals and shopping.
reviews.title: Good deal close to Philly

reviews.text: The rooms are average for a 3.5 stars hotel. Not that good, but not bad as well. The walls don't insulate noise very well though. We were able to hear conversations from the room next to us. If you have problems sleeping, that might be a deal-breaker. We slept just fine.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.text: The lobby and common areas are beautiful and well maintained. We had breakfast at the hotel and it was very good. The breakfast was included in our room rate.
reviews.title: Poor check in service - double billed

reviews.text: Overall it was a good deal for the price. The traffic to Philly was annoying but the hotel itself was good.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for Business Meeting

reviews.text: We have stayed here a few times when we come to King of Prussia just to shop once or twice a year. The hotel is very clean, well kept and comfortable. When we checked in the front desk person was very courteous and pleasant. We had the breakfast buffet this time and it was great. If I had one negative, it's the loud air conditioning unit, but overall wasn't a problem. We love staying here when we come to KoP!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: I come to this property one or two times a year on business. The hotel is a mid-tier property, but one of the best in the area. The only problem here is one girl at the check-in counter. Her attitude is terrible! Every time I come back I expect her to be gone, but there she is. I think the hotel keeps her on because she has an accent and maybe they think this brings an international flavor to the property. My strategy is to avoid her rather than become insulted by her rude indifference. Honestly, I just wait for the other host to become available. I suggest you do the same. That said, the rest of the staff here does the chain proud.
reviews.title: ONLY ONE PROBLEM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed at the Crown Plaza based upon the reviews here. All of the positive that has been said is true - the rooms are very clean and comfortable. This is an upscale hotel with an large, elegant lobby. The hotel is very big. The adjoining hotel that has been mentioned - a Fairfield is currently closed for renovation.
reviews.title: Very Fancy

reviews.text: The rooms are large and very nicely decorated. They are bright. The room we were assigned had no problems. There is both wired internet and wireless internet - and a cord is provided right on the desk in the room. This hotel had the largest and thickest bath towels that I have ever seen. They also have real facial tissues in the bathroom - not the scratchy kind most hotels give you.
reviews.title: Convenient to the Mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What should be noted is that there is NO free breakfast here. The breakfast buffet is $13.99. If you are a Priority Club member and have a room on the club floor there is a members only breakfast until 9:30 am but only Monday to Friday - not on the weekend.
reviews.title: great beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We don't eat breakfast so this did not matter to us but we thought that it was strange for a hotel at the top of the Holiday Inn chain not to give you what the less expensive hotels in the chain offer.
reviews.title: quality hotel, next to mall

reviews.text: For the price and based on the website I was expecting much more. What I got was a Holiday Inn with a marble entrance. If I return to Philly I will look into staying elsewhere.
reviews.title: Ehhh

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night for a visit to the Villanova campus. The public areas of the hotel are very nice, and we found the lobby, bar and restaurant to be well appointed. The AAA $113 rate was an okay value, but I would say $89-$99 would have been a more reasonable rate based upon the fairly small-sized rooms.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but AC unit in our room sounded like a moped.

reviews.text: The location is right across the street from the huge King of Prussia Mall. The mall is very nice and quite impressive in size and variety of stores and restaurants.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: Our room was small but clean, with a king sized bed that was fairly comfortable and a large flat screen TV. Our only real criticism was the air conditioning unit. We were in room 505, and each time the unit kicked in, the fan sounded like someone was starting a moped in the room. The fan was very loud and made it difficult to sleep. A maintenance man said that the unit needed to be refurbished, but there wasn't much he could do about it. We should have asked for another room, but were too tired to pack everything up and move to another room.
reviews.title: A Hotel with Good Amenities!

reviews.text: My advice: turn on the AC unit and see how it sounds before unpacking. The maintenance man advised there were several other rooms with AC units needing refurbishments. Rather than take the chance of getting another loud room, we will probably stay in one of the many nearby hotels next time.
reviews.title: Great Shopping Package

reviews.text: I wanted to visit the King of Prussia mall. I could not have found a better hotel that was nearer or more comfortable.
reviews.title: Great for shopping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean, staff very friendly and it was across the road from the largest Mall in the USA. It was 2 minutes from the hotel lobby, to Macy's.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

likes.liked: — convenient to King of Prussia mall

reviews.text: As part of the package, guests are allowed to use the Bally's gym next door. The gym was outstanding with a fantastic pool, whirlpool, sauna and steam room.
reviews.title: Okay for the business travelers

reviews.text: I was upgraded to an executive suite and the Flat screen TV was excellent and the room service contained much choice and a tasty burger. Even though it was November, I found the weather to be unusally warm and the air con in the hotel room came in very handy.
reviews.title: Okay, but some problems

likes.disliked: — Rudeness of staff person while trying to resolve a billing issue.

reviews.text: There was lots of free parking and plenty to do. Philadelphia city centre is around a 20-30 minute drive away.
reviews.title: Isolated and Basic

reviews.text: this is an average but clean and decent hotel. Good sized rooms and OK food. However it is right opposite the King of Prussia mall, probably one of the biggest malls on the east coast.
reviews.title: average hotel, fantastic shopping

reviews.text: Hotel provides free ride for upto 5mile radius destinations. No fitness/ swimming pool but there is Bally's next door.
reviews.title: pleasant hotel

reviews.text: This is a very pleasant hotel, and definitely a cut above the normal chain hotel. I would definitely stay here again as the beds were very comfortable, everything was very clean, most of the time the food was good and delivered on time. The only issue we had was one meal was way too "hot"....as in they put so much hot sauce on it, it was uneatible. And we love "hot" food.....so it was really, really hot. The staff was helpful and pleasant, and I would recommend this hotel if your travels take you to this part of Philadelphia. If you want an above average chain hotel experience, stay here.
reviews.title: Pretty good room service

reviews.text: It's about 35-40 minute taxi ride from PAX.
reviews.title: Great Beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very close to mall and food.
reviews.title: Great choice!

likes.disliked: — could have provided a table with the sofa

reviews.text: We had the good fortune of being upgraded to an Executive Suite and it was very nice! Spacious and set up for entertaining with wet bar & refrigerator in living room. Granite (or granite like) counters and some table tops, clean right down to the carpet. Refrig in bedroom also. Large, flat screen, hi def TV in bedroom and living room. The only employees we had contact with were at check in and check out, and they were VERY polite and helpful. The bed & pillows couldn't have been better!
reviews.title: Very nice, clean, give it a try

reviews.text: This large business hotel located near the shopping mall of King of Prussia is big with business travelers, conventions and for large group events.
reviews.title: Business hotel, spacious rooms, very good breakfast.

reviews.text: The room was above average size, and with the expected high quality furnishings and bedding found in Crown Plazas. The included breakfast was of unusually high quality and variety; more than just continental, it included several staffed hot buffet lines with surprisingly good food. A nice start to the morning before the office.
reviews.title: Good mid-range hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights, easy check in and very friendly staff. You need a car to get around the area and taxis are usually waiting outside the hotel so keep that in mind. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean but smelled like smoke. It is very easy to get across to the huge mall (just across the street). Overall I think this was the best option for the area.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Staying at the Crown Plaza, was a pleasure. The adjoining room request was granted, room service was pleasent and the breakfast buffet was one of the best. The hotel is within walking distance to the King of Prussia Mall. They do offer use of the Ballys gym, which has a pool, but it is not inside the hotel. One must walk outside to gain axcess to the facilities.
reviews.title: Already reserved for next year!!

reviews.text: Great service, even when we checked in almost 6 hours late at 3am. Nice room. When we got in the pull-out bed was already set up and turned down. Good food downstairs. If you're a Crowne Club member you get an awesome continental breakfast set up in the room they have on the fifth floor. We'll be back. Only down side is the fact that the gym and pool offered is at Bally's just a couple hundred feet away... and they have really crappy hours.
reviews.title: very nice, we'll keep coming

reviews.text: The hotel was absolutely beautiful! Very clean , lots of little lounge areas with chairs/couches & even a piano! The entire staff was pleasant and accomodating. No matter what time of the day/night you were walking around the hotel if a staff member saw you they said hello & asked how you were enjoying your stay. That was really nice. The rooms were spacious, clean & very nice!
reviews.title: A bit like the Titanic! Beautiful, but at times not practical!

reviews.text: Cons: No IPOD dock in the room (it's almost expected in this day & age, & I've been to lower priced competitors who have it), the one elevator sounded so bad like a cable was going to snap at any moment (not cool!), no baby changing station in the women's restroom (there were alot of families there & I heard this commented on several times), there was not an on-site pool; you had to leave the hotel & walk across to the other hotel (Fairfield Marriot) and into their hotel, down 2 long hallways into the Bally's center just to use the pool & hottub (that was very inconvenient)!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.text: Pros: Very clean, staff was amazingly nice, beautiful lobby set up, good water pressure in bathroom, free Wifi in room access, beds were comfortable, flat screen tvs were great, business center with vending machines was convenient and the buffet breakfast for 13.95 was very yummy!
reviews.title: Another Great Stay in KOP

reviews.text: Overall I think I'd stay here in the summer, but stayin the winter it would be inconvenient having to walk outside & into the cold just to get to the pool located in another hotel. The staff is one of the biggest reasons I would go back.
reviews.title: Best Hotel for KOP Mall shopping!

description: The Crowne Plaza Hotel Valley Forge is the premier hotel in the King of Prussia area. Just 18 miles west of Philadelphia our hotel offers beautifully appointed guest rooms featuring the Crowne Plaza Sleep Advantage and free wired and wireless high-speed Internet access. Located directly across from the King of Prussia Mall which offers 3 million sq. ft. of retail space including Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, Bloomingdale's and over 400 exclusive shops and restaurants. The hotel is just minutes from Exit 326 of the PA Turnpike, the Valley Forge Convention Center, Valley Forge National Park and Valley Forge Military Academy. . All guests receive free access to Bally Total Fitness, a 40,000 sq. ft., full service health club with complete strength training facilities; large indoor lap pool and Jacuzzi and a full complement of aerobic machines and conditioning classes - located just a short walk across the parking lot. The Crowne Plaza Valley Forge boasts 23,000 sq. ft. of function space including two elegant ballrooms and a total of 18 meeting rooms, highlighted by the International Association of Conference Center approved Liberty Conference Center featuring a 132-seat amphitheater, in-house audio/visual expertise and ample breakout rooms. A friendly, attentive and reliable service staff looks forward to your arrival!
